transliteration: Nival Aadh Karamanndng|| Anant Daan Dharamanndng||
translation: The performance of Neoli Karma (cleansing of intestines): the innumerable religious acts of giving charities;

gurmukhi: AnMq qIrQ bwsnM ]n eyk nwm ky smM ]11]89]
transliteration: Anant Teerath Baasanan|| Na Ek Naam Ke Samannd||1189||
translation: Abiding at pilgrim-stations for numberless times; all these acts do not equal do not equal the merit of the remembrance of the Name of One Lord.11.89.

transliteration: Anant Jaggya Karamanndng|| Gadaadh Aadh Dharamanndng||
translation: The performance of innumerable acts of sacrifices; the performance of the religious act of giving elephants etc. in charity;

gurmukhi: Anyk dys BrmxM ]n eyk nwm ky smM ]12]90]
transliteration: Anek Des Bharamanndng|| Na Ek Naam Ke Samannd||12||90||
translation: Wandering in many countries; all these acts do not equal the merit of the remembrance of the Name of One Lord.12.90.

transliteration: Ikant Kount Baasanan|| Bhramannd Kotakan Banan||
translation: Dwelling in solitary confinement; wandering in millions of forests;

transliteration: Ouchaat Naad Karamanndng|| Anek Udaas Bharamanndng||13||91||
translation: Becoming unattached many recite mantras; many roam like hermits.13.91.

transliteration: Anek Bhekh Aasanan|| Daror Kotakan Bratan||
translation: Many move in various guises and adopt several postures; millions hold million types of fasts.

transliteration: Ouchaat Naad Karamanndng|| Anek Bhekh Pekhanan||14||92||
translation: One may roam in many directions; he may observe many types of guises.14.92.

transliteration: Daror Kot Daanakan|| Anek Jagya Kratabbyan||
translation: One may perform m,illions of types of charities; he may perform many types of sacrifices and actions.

transliteration: Sanniaas Aadh Dharamanndng|| Udaas Naam Karamanndng||15||93||
translation: One may adopt the religious garb of mendicant; he may perform many rituals of a hermit. 15.93.

transliteration: Anek Paath Paathanan|| Anant Thaat Thaatanan||
translation: One may read the religious texts continuously; he may perform many ostentations.

gurmukhi: n eyk nwm ky smM sm`sq siRst ky BRmM ]16]94]
transliteration: Na Ek Naam Ke Samannd|| Samast Srist Ke Bhramannd||16||94||
translation: None of them equals the Name of One Lord; they are all an illusion like the world.16.94.

transliteration: Jagaddh Aadh Dharamanndng|| Bairaag Aadh Karamanndng||
translation: One may perform the religious acts of the ancient ages; he may perform the ascetic and monastic works.

transliteration: Dayaadh Aadh Kaamanndng|| Anaadh Sanjamannd Bridan||17||95||
translation: He may perform the works of mercy etc., and magic; they are all wworks of great restraint, prevalent from times immemorial.17.95.
